tool.name: PrelimTerrainLoss

param.name: demInput
param.dialogReference: The raster dataset or mosaic dataset that represents elevation values. Raster should be in a projected coordinate system, preferably State Plane or UTM. Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: aoi_boundary
param.dialogReference: Polygon that defines the area to be assessed. The input elevation raster should extend at least one row length beyond the area of interest boundary.

param.name: tracker_length
param.dialogReference: The length of the tracker rows in feet or meters. Default: 300. Tracker length can be an estimate. .

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the vertical and horizontal units of the Input elevation raster and tracker length (Foot or Meter). Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection as well as the units of the tracker length.

param.name: block_width
param.dialogReference: The width of a full-size mechanical block. Block width can be estimated.

param.name: prelimLossOut
param.displayname: Preliminary terrain loss estimate output raster
param.dialogReference: A raster that represents the percent loss or gain from a generic specific production

param.name: ewnsOption
param.displayname: Output individual east-west and north-south loss rasters?
param.dialogReference: Allows for the output of rasters that represent the east-west losses and the north-south losses

param.name: ewLossOut
param.displayname: Preliminary east-west terrain loss estimate output raster
param.dialogReference: A raster that represents the percent loss or gain from a generic specific production for the east-west directions

param.name: nsLossOut
param.displayname: Preliminary north-south terrain loss estimate output raster
param.dialogReference: A raster that represents the percent loss or gain from a generic specific production for the north-southt directions

tool.summary: Estimates the losses with respect to terrain for single axis trackers without a layout. The tool examines the variation of terrain east-west and slopes north-south to determine potential terrain losses across a given area.
tool.usage:
• This tool analyzes east-west and north-south slope and variation to determine percent terrain loss to help determine optimal placement for tracker arrays.

  • No layout is required, but results should be treated as preliminary.

  • Output is one raster that represents percent gain or loss based on the terrain (positive is a gain over specific production, negative a loss).

This tool is most useful to guide layout design to avoid areas where grading will be problematic.
